sen.j: 庚午事変（こうごじへん）は、1870年に当時の徳島藩淡路島洲本城下で洲本市在住の蜂須賀氏臣の武士が、家老稲田邦植の別邸や学問所などを襲った事件。
sen.e: Kogo Jihen was an incident in which vassals of the HACHISUKA clan, who lived in Sumoto City, attacked the second residence of chief retainer Kunitane INADA and a place of study and other places below Sumoto castle on Awaji-shima Island of that time in 1870.

Kogo Jihen was an incident in which vassals of the Hachisuka clan, who lived in Sumoto City, attacked the second residence of chief retainer Kunitane Inada and a place of study and other places near the Sumoto castle on Awaji-shima Island, Tokushima domain of that time in 1870.
sen.cmt: 「～城下」は、用語集で'near the -castle' とあったので変えました。又、徳島藩の訳抜けだったので加えました。
sen.e: Kogo Jihen was an incident in which vassals of the Hachisuka clan, who lived in Sumoto City, attacked the second residence of chief retainer Kunitane Inada and a place of study and other places near the Sumoto-jo Castle on Awaji-shima Island, Tokushima domain of that time in 1870.

sen.j: 稲田騒動（いなだそうどう）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: That incident is also called Inada Sodo (Inada riot).
That incident is also called Inada Sodo (Inada riot).
That incident is also called Inada Sodo (Inada riot).

sen.j: 徳島藩洲本城代家老稲田家（1万4千石）は、徳島本藩との様々な確執が以前よりあった。
sen.e: Before this incident, chief retainer INADA of Sumoto-jo Castle in Tokushima Domain (14,000 koku) had had various conflicts with Tokushima Honpan (the original domain) for some time.
Before this incident, chief retainer INADA of Sumoto-jo Castle in Tokushima Domain (14,000 koku) had had various conflicts with Tokushima Honpan (the original domain) for some time.
Before this incident, chief retainer INADA of Sumoto-jo Castle in Tokushima Domain (14,000 koku) had had various conflicts with Tokushima Honpan (the original domain) for some time.

sen.j: 幕末期、本藩側は佐幕派に対し稲田側では尊王派であり、稲田側の倒幕活動が活発化していくにつれ本藩側との対立をさらに深めていくようになった。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, the Honpan side were supporters of the bakufu, but the INADA side were royalists, so the more the INADA side acted to overthrow the bakufu, the deeper their confrontation against the Honpan side.

At the end of the Edo period, the Honpan side were supporters of the bakufu, but the Inada side were royalists, so the more the Inada side acted to overthrow the bakufu, the more serious their confrontation with the Honpan side became.
sen.cmt: 「対立をさらに深めていくようになった」 を the deeper ではなく the more serious でconfrontation を受けてwith にしました。動詞抜けで became を加えました。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, the Honpan side were supporters of the bakufu, but the Inada side were royalists, so the more the Inada side acted to overthrow the bakufu, the more serious their confrontation with the Honpan side became.

sen.j: そして明治維新後、徳島藩の禄制改革により徳島本藩の家臣は士族とされた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, because of the Honpan's Rokusei reformation from the Tokushima Domain, the vassals of the Tokushima Honpan came to be regarded as warrior class.
After the Meiji Restoration, under the Tokushima domain's Rokusei reformation (the reform in salary system), the vassals of the Tokushima Honpan came to be regarded as warrior class.
sen.cmt: 「禄制改革」について、説明を加えました。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, under the Tokushima domain's Rokusei reformation (the reform in salary system), the vassals of the Tokushima Honpan came to be regarded as warrior class.

sen.j: しかし、陪臣(徳島本藩の家臣)である稲田氏の家臣は卒族とされた事に稲田氏の家臣は納得できず、自分達の士族編入を徳島本藩に訴えかけた。
sen.e: However, the vassals of the INADA clan, as baishin (indirect vassals), did not agree with allowing themselves to be relegated to sotsuzoku rank (low-ranking samurai), and claimed their incorporation as warrior class to the Tokushima Honpan.

However, the vassals of the Inada clan, as baishin (indirect vassals), did not agree with allowing themselves to be relegated to sotsuzoku rank (low-ranking samurai), and requested the Tokushima Honpan to incorporate their rank into warrior class.
sen.cmt: 「自分達の氏族編入を徳島藩に訴えかけた」の箇所をより具体的に変えました。
sen.e: However, the vassals of the Inada clan, as baishin (indirect vassals), did not agree with allowing themselves to be relegated to sotsuzoku rank (low-ranking samurai), and requested the Tokushima Honpan to incorporate their rank into warrior class.

sen.j: それが叶わないとみるや今度は洲本を中心に淡路を徳島本藩から分藩独立させて稲田氏を藩主とする稲田藩（洲本藩）の設立を目指す(そうすれば自分達は士族になる)ようになり、明治新政府にも独立を働きかけていくようになる。
sen.e: They soon found that their wish could not be granted, in turn, they moved to separate Awaji with Sumoto as its center from the Tokushima Honpan and enable it be self-sufficient, and aimed to establish the INADA Domain of which the leader of the domain would be the INADA clan (so that they would become warrior class), and also asked the new Meiji Government to be independent.

When they found that would not be granted, in turn, they moved to spin off Awaji with Sumoto as its center from the Tokushima Honpan and aimed to establish the INADA Domain, of which the leader would be the INADA clan (so that they would become warrior class), and also worked on the new Meiji Government for their independence.
sen.cmt: 第一文と第二文に接続詞がなかったので when を加え、「分藩独立」を spin off にまとめました。又、'asked the new Meiji Government to be independent' は原文と意味が違っているので変えました。
sen.e: When they found that would not be granted, in turn, they moved to spin off Awaji with Sumoto as its center from the Tokushima Honpan and aimed to establish the INADA Domain, of which the leader would be the INADA clan (so that they would become warrior class), and also worked on the new Meiji Government for their independence.

sen.j: 稲田側は幕末時の活躍によりすぐ認められると思っていた。
sen.e: The INADA side thought their request would be approved soon due to the achievement at the end of the Edo period.
The INADA side thought their request would be approved soon due to the achievement at the end of the Edo period.
The INADA side thought their request would be approved soon due to the achievement at the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 稲田側こうした一連の行動に怒った本藩側の一部過激派藩士らが、明治3年5月13日_(旧暦)（1870年6月11日）、洲本城下の稲田家とその藩士らの屋敷を襲撃した。
sen.e: One group of radical retainers on the Honpan side, who got upset about continuing unacceptable conduct on the INADA side, attacked the residence of the INADA family and their feudal retainers of the domain below the Sumoto-jo Castle on June 11, 1870.

One group of radical retainers on the Honpan side, who got upset about a series of unacceptable conduct of the INADA side, attacked the residences of the Inada family's and their retainers' near the Sumoto-jo Castle on June 11, 1870.
sen.cmt: 「本城下の稲田家とその藩士らの屋敷」を the residences of the INADA family's and their retainers' near the Sumoto-jo Castleとresidenceを複数形にし、それぞれを所有各にしました。
sen.e: One group of radical retainers on the Honpan side, who got upset about a series of unacceptable conduct of the INADA side, attacked the residences of the Inada family's and their retainers' near the Sumoto-jo Castle on June 11, 1870.

sen.j: またその前日には徳島でも稲田屋敷を焼き討ちし、脇町（現：美馬市）周辺にある稲田家の配地に進軍。
sen.e: On the previous day, they also set fire to the INADA residence in Tokushima, and advanced to the region dominated by the INADA family which was around Wakimachi (now: Mima City).
On the previous day, they also set fire to the Inada's residence in Tokushima, and advanced to the Inada family's territory located around Wakimachi (now: Mima City).
sen.cmt: 「配地」は簡単に territory にしました。
sen.e: On the previous day, they also set fire to the Inada's residence in Tokushima, and advanced to the Inada family's territory located around Wakimachi (now: Mima City).

sen.j: これに対し稲田側は一切無抵抗でいた。
sen.e: In response, the INADA side was completely unable to resist.
The Inada side, however, was completely unable to resist it.
sen.cmt: 「これに対し」の「これ」を in response よりも it というresist の目的語にしました。
sen.e: The Inada side, however, was completely unable to resist it.

sen.j: これによる稲田側の被害は、自決2人、即死15人、重傷6人、軽傷14人。
sen.e: This incident resulted in 2 suicides, 15 instant deaths, 6 serious injuries and 14 minor injuries.
Inada's damage caused by this incident was 2 suicides, 15 instant deaths, 6 serious injuries and 14 minor injuries.
sen.cmt: 「稲田側の被害」の訳抜けだったので加えました。
sen.e: Inada's damage caused by this incident was 2 suicides, 15 instant deaths, 6 serious injuries and 14 minor injuries.

sen.j: 他に投獄監禁された者は300人余り。
sen.e: Another 300-odd people were imprisoned.
Another 300-odd people were imprisoned.
Another 300-odd people were imprisoned.

sen.j: 焼き払われた屋敷25棟。
sen.e: 25 residences were burned.
25 residences were burned.
25 residences were burned.

sen.j: 政府は一部の激派だけの単独暴動なのか、藩庁が裏で激派を煽動していたりはしなかったか調査した。
sen.e: The government investigated whether it was a riot by just one extremist group, or whether the government building in the domain added oil to the flames with the extremist group behind the scenes.
The government investigated whether it was a riot caused by just one extremist group, or the government building in the domain stirred the extremist group behind the scenes.
sen.cmt: 「煽動していた」を,人を目的語にするstirにしました。
sen.e: The government investigated whether it was a riot caused by just one extremist group, or the government building in the domain stirred the extremist group behind the scenes.

sen.j: 少なくとも洲本では意欲的に緊急措置を怠った疑いがある。
sen.e: In Sumoto at least, there were suspicions that they deliberately failed to take immediate steps to intervene.
In Sumoto at least, there were suspicions that they deliberately failed to take immediate steps to intervene.
In Sumoto at least, there were suspicions that they deliberately failed to take immediate steps to intervene.

sen.j: そのような事実が少しでもあれば容赦なく蜂須賀茂韶を知事から罷免するつもりであった。
sen.e: If there was any sign that it was the fact, they intended to discharge Mochiaki HACHISUKA from the post of prefectural governor forthwith.
If there was any sign that showed the fact, they intended to discharge Mochiaki HACHISUKA from the post of prefectural governor forthwith.
If they found any hint of truth to this, they intended to discharge Mochiaki HACHISUKA from the post of prefectural governor forthwith.

sen.j: 政府は版籍奉還後も藩主が藩知事となっているだけで、 旧体制と何ら変わらない。
sen.e: After the return of lands and people to the emperor, the government was still not different from the old regime at all except that the lord of the domain became govenor of the domain.
After the return of lands and people to the emperor, the government was still not different from the old regime at all except that the lord of the domain became govenor of the domain.
After the return of lands and people to the emperor, the government was still not different from the old regime at all except that the lord of the domain became govenor of the domain.

sen.j: 中央集権化を推進していくうえで、この問題は是非とも克服してゆかねばならない。
sen.e: Upon the implementation of centralization, this problem had to be overcome at whatever cost.
Upon the implementation of centralization, this problem had to be overcome at whatever cost.
Upon the implementation of centralization, this problem had to be overcome at whatever cost.

sen.j: だが下手な手の付け方をすれば、日本中に反政府の武装蜂起が起こりかねない。
sen.e: However, if they made a bad job of undertaking some action, an armed uprising of antigovernment forces would have occured throughout Japan.
However, if they made a bad job of undertaking some action, an armed uprising of antigovernment forces would have occured throughout Japan.
However, if they made a bad job of undertaking some action, an armed uprising of antigovernment forces would have occured throughout Japan.

sen.j: 結局、政府からの処分は、徳島藩側主謀者小倉富三郎・新居水竹ら10人が斬首（のちに藩知事の嘆願陳情で切腹になる）。
sen.e: Eventually, the punishment from the government was that 10 people, including Tomisaburo OGURA and Suichiku NII who were key leaders in the Tokushima Domain, were decapitated (they commited Seppuku [ritural suicide] at the petition to appeal of the governor of domain, later).

Eventually, the punishment from the government was that 10 people, including Tomisaburo OGURA and Suichiku NII, who were the key leaders from the Tokushima Domain, were decapitated (they committed Seppuku [ritual suicide] at the petition to appeal of the governor of the domain, later).
sen.cmt: 先行詞が固有名詞なのでwhoの前にカンマをいれて非制限用法にしました。
sen.e: Eventually, the punishment from the government was that 10 people, including Tomisaburo OGURA and Suichiku NII, who were the key leaders from the Tokushima Domain, were decapitated (they committed Seppuku [ritual suicide] at the petition to appeal of the governor of the domain, later).

sen.j: これは日本法制史上、最後の切腹刑となる。
sen.e: It is the last case of Seppuku as a legal punishment in Japanese history.
It is the last case of Seppuku as a legal punishment in Japanese history.
It is the last case of Seppuku as a legal punishment in Japanese history.

sen.j: 八丈島への終身流刑は27人、81人が禁固、謹慎など多数に至るに及んだ。
sen.e: The number of the people was extended such as 27 people were sentenced to life deportation to Hachijo-jima Island, 81 people were sentenced to imprisonment and house arrest.
A lot of people were punished; 27 people were sentenced to life deportation to Hachijo-jima Island, 81 people were sentenced to imprisonment and house arrest and so on.
sen.cmt: The number of the people was extended such asのくだりがわかりにくいように思ったので「多数が罰された」として A lot of people were punishedにしました。
sen.e: A lot of people were punished; 27 people were sentenced to life deportation to Hachijo-jima Island, 81 people were sentenced to imprisonment and house arrest and so on.

sen.j: 藩知事や参事らも謹慎処分を受け、藩自体の取り潰しはなかったものの、洲本を含む津名郡は明治4年5月に兵庫県に編入されている。
sen.e: The governor of domain, secretary and others were also sentenced to house arrest, dissolution and forfeiture of the Domain itself did not happen, though the Tsuna District including Sumoto was merged with Hyogo Prefecture in May, 1871.

The governor of the domain and secretaries were also sentenced to house arrest, and although the Domain escaped dissolution or forfeiture, the Tsuna District including Sumoto was merged into Hyogo Prefecture in May, 1871.
sen.cmt: 文意から主節と譲歩の副詞節をかえました。また接続詞はalthoughにしました。又、「取り潰しはなかった」の動詞をdid not happenからescape(免れる)にしました。
sen.e: The governor of the domain and secretaries were also sentenced to house arrest, and although the Domain escaped dissolution or forfeiture, the Tsuna District including Sumoto was merged into Hyogo Prefecture in May, 1871.

sen.j: 稲田側に対しては、この事件を口実に北海道静内町と色丹島の配地を与えるという名目で、兵庫県管轄の士族として移住開拓を命じ、彼らは荒野の広がる北の大地へと旅立っていった。
sen.e: For the INADA side, the government used this incident as an excuse to order them to migrate as warrior class in Hyogo Prefecture jurisdiction, under the guise of being granted areas of territory in Sizunai-cho, Hokkaido and Shikotan-to Island, and the INADA clain went to the wild North districts.

For the Inada side, the government used this incident as an excuse to order them to migrate as warrior class in Hyogo Prefecture jurisdiction, under the guise of granting the territory in Sizunai-cho, Hokkaido and Shikotan-to Island, and the Inada clan went to the wild North districts.
sen.cmt: 「与えるという名目で」under the guise of granting the territoryと「与える」の意味を能動態にしました。
sen.e: For the Inada side, the government used this incident as an excuse to order them to migrate as warrior class in Hyogo Prefecture jurisdiction, under the guise of granting the territory in Sizunai-cho, Hokkaido and Shikotan-to Island, and the Inada clan went to the wild North districts.

sen.j: この静内移住開拓については船山馨の小説『お登勢 (船山馨)』や、2005年1月公開の映画『北の零年』でも描かれている。
sen.e: This Sizunai migration is portrayed in a novel, "Otose (Kaoru HUNAYAMA)" and a movie, "Kita no Zero nen (Year One in the North)" which was released in May, 2005.
This Sizunai migration is portrayed in a novel, "Otose (written by Kaoru HUNAYAMA)" and a movie, "Kita no Zero nen (Year One in the North)" which was released in May, 2005.
sen.cmt: 「船山馨」が著者であることをわかるようにしました。
sen.e: This Sizunai migration is portrayed in a novel, "Otose (written by Kaoru HUNAYAMA)" and a movie, "Kita no Zero nen (Year One in the North)" which was released in May, 2005.

sen.j: なお、洲本市立淡路文化史料館では、「庚午事変」のコーナーが常設展示され、事件当時の事を綴った稲田氏の家臣の手記などが展示されている。
sen.e: In addition, there is a permanent exhibition of 'Kogo Jihen' section at Awajishima Museum and some historical items are on display, such as a memorandum of a vassal in the INADA clan writing about the incidents in those days.

In addition, there is a permanent exhibition of 'Kogo Jihen' section at Awajishima Museum and some historical items are on display, such as a notebook of a vassal of the Inada clan recording the incident.
sen.cmt: 「手記」をnotebookにし、「を綴った」をwritingから recordingにしました。
sen.e: In addition, there is a permanent exhibition of 'Kogo Jihen' section at Awajishima Museum and some historical items are on display, such as a notebook of a vassal of the Inada clan recording the incident.

sen.j: この事件がなければ淡路島は今も徳島県であった可能性が高い。
sen.e: If these incidents did not happen, it would be quite possible that Awaji-shima Island would be still in Tokushima Prefecture.
If these incidents had not happened, it would be quite possible that Awaji-shima Island would be still in Tokushima Prefecture.
sen.cmt: if節を、過去のことなので仮定法過去完了にしました。
sen.e: If these incidents had not happened, it would be quite possible that Awaji-shima Island would be still in Tokushima Prefecture.
